Defense Donald Rumsfeld Robert Gates will soon lift the ban on initiating new cases against Guantanamo detainees in preparation to increase the use of military commissions for prosecution. Imposed on the day of Barack Obama 's inauguration, the overturned ban will be accompanied by" an executive order to create a parole board-like system" to review cases of nearly 50 detainees who would be held without trial. It is a marathon, not a sprint, he said." It is a competition of ideas. For whatever reason, we are hesitant and not skillful in engaging in the competition of ideas."
